trans-unit.source: Modifies XAML compilation behavior, such that fields for named object references are defined with public access rather than the private default behavior.
trans-unit.target: Modifies XAML compilation behavior, such that fields for named object references are defined with public access rather than the private default behavior.

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Modifies XAML compilation behavior, such that fields for named object references are defined with **public** access rather than the **private** default behavior.
trans-unit.target: Modifies XAML compilation behavior, such that fields for named object references are defined with **public** access rather than the **private** default behavior.

trans-unit.source: [x:Name attribute](x-name-attribute.md) must also be provided on the same element.
trans-unit.target: [x:Name attribute](x-name-attribute.md) must also be provided on the same element.

trans-unit.source: The value for the **x:FieldModifier** attribute will vary by programming language.
trans-unit.target: The value for the **x:FieldModifier** attribute will vary by programming language.

trans-unit.source: The string to use will depend on how each language implements its **CodeDomProvider** and the type converters it returns to define the meanings for **TypeAttributes.Public** and **TypeAttributes.NotPublic**.
trans-unit.target: The string to use will depend on how each language implements its **CodeDomProvider** and the type converters it returns to define the meanings for **TypeAttributes.Public** and **TypeAttributes.NotPublic**.

trans-unit.source: For C#, Microsoft Visual Basic or Visual C++ component extensions (C++/CX), you can give the string value "public" or "Public"; the parser doesn't enforce case on this attribute value.
trans-unit.target: For C#, Microsoft Visual Basic or Visual C++ component extensions (C++/CX), you can give the string value "public" or "Public"; the parser doesn't enforce case on this attribute value.

trans-unit.source: You can also specify **NonPublic** (**internal** in C# or C++/CX, **Friend** in Visual Basic) but this is uncommon.
trans-unit.target: You can also specify **NonPublic** (**internal** in C# or C++/CX, **Friend** in Visual Basic) but this is uncommon.

trans-unit.source: Internal access doesn't have any application to the Windows Runtime XAML code generation model.
trans-unit.target: Internal access doesn't have any application to the Windows Runtime XAML code generation model.

trans-unit.source: **x:FieldModifier** is only relevant for elements with an [x:Name attribute](x-name-attribute.md), because that name is used to reference the field once it is public.
trans-unit.target: **x:FieldModifier** is only relevant for elements with an [x:Name attribute](x-name-attribute.md), because that name is used to reference the field once it is public.

trans-unit.source: **Note** Windows Runtime XAML doesn't support **x:ClassModifier** or **x:Subclass**.
trans-unit.target: **Note** Windows Runtime XAML doesn't support **x:ClassModifier** or **x:Subclass**.
